1.「<%sL_SELECTED_CLASS>が できるのを| だれでもＯＫにします: Do you want to allow anyone to do|<%sL_SELECTED_CLASS>?<yesno><break>

9.「この家の 権限設定を変更できます。| 変更したい項目を お選びください。|<b: You can change the permission settings for|this house... Select the items you wish to|change...<break>

14.「申し訳ありませんが| 設定できませんでした。| もう一度 ご指示ください。: I'm sorry, I can't set it up. Please try|again.

15.「家具機能の利用は フレンドにのみ| 設定することができます。|<br>|「変更: The furniture feature can only be set up for|friends. Please select the items you want to|change...<break>

16.「フレンドの情報を 取得できませんでした。| 時間を置いて もう一度 お試しくだ: Unable to retrieve friend information...|Please give it some time and try again...<bw_break>

Now that we've set access to the house to|"open to all," we can make this house a|welcome home... Do you know what a welcome|
|house is?

19.「では この家を| ウェルカムハウスに 設定しますか？|<yesno><brea: So, would you like to set up this house as a|welcome home?<yesno><break>

Let me explain. If we set it up as a welcome|house, a lot of people might find this house|and come to visit. The welcome house can also|
|be accessed from the sign, and balloons will|be placed on the sign outside the house so|that other people can easily find it.|
|However, there may be a lot of people in the|house, so please be careful when setting|permissions on furniture...

|outside your house so that other people can|easily see you... When I set up a Welcome|House, the "Access to My Town" setting is|
